For any other object type, it's a hard delete. Track the occurrence of hard-delete events by comparing \"Delete \\\" events with the type of object that was deleted. Note the events that don't support soft delete. Also note \"Hard Delete \\\" events.\n+A delete event for applications, users, Microsoft 365 Groups, and cloud security groups is a soft delete. For any other object type, it's a hard delete. Track the occurrence of hard-delete events by comparing \"Delete \\\" events with the type of object that was deleted. Note the events that don't support soft delete. Also note \"Hard Delete \\\" events.\n \n | Object type | Activity in log| Result |\n | - | - | - |\n@@ -37,10 +37,12 @@ A delete event for applications, users, and Microsoft 365 Groups is a soft delet\n | User| Hard delete user| Hard deleted |\n | Microsoft 365 Group| Delete group| Soft deleted |\n | Microsoft 365 Group| Hard delete group| Hard deleted |\n+| Cloud security group| Delete group| Soft deleted |\n+| Cloud security group| Hard delete group| Hard deleted |\n | All other objects| Delete \"objectType\"| Hard deleted |\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> The audit log doesn't distinguish the group type of a deleted group. Only Microsoft 365 Groups are soft deleted. If you see a Delete group entry, it might be the soft delete of a Microsoft 365 Group or the hard delete of another type of group.\n+> The audit log doesn't distinguish the group type of a deleted group. Microsoft 365 Groups and cloud security groups are soft deleted. If you see a Delete group entry, it might be the soft delete of a Microsoft 365 Group or cloud security group, or the hard delete of another type of group.\n >\n >*It's important that your documentation of your known good state includes the group type for each group in your organization*. To learn more about documenting your known good state, see [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md).\n \n@@ -50,7 +52,7 @@ A sudden increase in support tickets about access to a specific object might ind\n \n ## Soft deletions\n \n-When objects such as users, Microsoft 365 Groups, or application registrations are soft deleted, they enter a suspended state in which they aren't available for use by other services. In this state, items keep their properties and can be restored for 30 days. After 30 days, objects in the soft-deleted state are permanently deleted or hard deleted.\n+When objects such as users, Microsoft 365 Groups, cloud security groups, or application registrations are soft deleted, they enter a suspended state in which they aren't available for use by other services. In this state, items keep their properties and can be restored for 30 days. After 30 days, objects in the soft-deleted state are permanently deleted or hard deleted.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n > Objects can't be restored from a hard-deleted state. Re-create and reconfigure them.\n@@ -71,9 +73,9 @@ Common scenarios for deleting users include:\n * A user moves out of scope for synchronization with Microsoft Entra Connect.\n * A user retires, is removed from an HR system, and is deprovisioned via an automated workflow.\n \n-### Microsoft 365 Groups\n+### Groups\n \n-The most frequent scenarios for deleting Microsoft 365 Groups are:\n+The most frequent scenarios for deleting groups are:\n \n * An administrator intentionally deletes the group, for example, in response to a support request.\n * An automation script in Microsoft Graph or PowerShell triggers the deletion. For example, you might have a script that deletes groups that aren't accessed or attested to by the group owner for a specified time.\n@@ -102,6 +104,7 @@ Not all object classes manage soft-delete capabilities in the Microsoft Entra ad\n |---|---|\n |Users (including external users)|All properties maintained, including ObjectID, group memberships, roles, licenses, and application assignments|\n |Microsoft 365 Groups|All properties maintained, including ObjectID, group memberships, licenses, and application assignments|\n+|Cloud security groups|All properties maintained, including ObjectID, group memberships, and application assignments|\n |Application registration | All properties maintained. Microsoft 365 Groups and cloud security groups in the Azure portal on the **Groups | Deleted groups** page.\n \n ![Screenshot that shows restoring groups in the Azure portal.](media/recoverability/deletion-restore-groups.png)\n \n-For more information on how to restore soft-deleted Microsoft 365 Groups, see the following documentation:\n+For more information on how to restore soft-deleted Microsoft 365 Groups and cloud security groups, see the following documentation:\n \n * To restore from the Azure portal, see [Restore a deleted Microsoft 365 "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecoverability-overview.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecoverability-overview.md?ref=572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e", "patch": "@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ manager: martinco\n ms.service: entra\n ms.subservice: architecture\n ms.topic: best-practice\n-ms.date: 08/26/2022\n+ms.date: 11/03/2025\n ms.author: jricketts\n ms.reviewer: jricketts\n ---\n@@ -29,9 +29,9 @@ Deletions and misconfigurations have different impacts on your tenant.\n \n The impact of deletions depends on the object type.\n \n-Users, Microsoft 365 Groups, and applications can be soft deleted. Soft-deleted items are sent to the Microsoft Entra ID recycle bin. While in the recycle bin, items aren't available for use. However, they retain all their properties and can be restored via a Microsoft Graph API call or in the Azure portal. Items in the soft-delete state that aren't restored within 30 days are permanently, or hard, deleted.\n+Users, Microsoft 365 Groups, cloud security groups, and applications can be soft deleted. Soft-deleted items are sent to the Microsoft Entra ID recycle bin. While in the recycle bin, items aren't available for use. However, they retain all their properties and can be restored via a Microsoft Graph API call or in the Azure portal. Items in the soft-delete state that aren't restored within 30 days are permanently, or hard, deleted.\n \n-![Diagram that shows that users, Microsoft 365 Groups, and applications are soft deleted and then hard deleted after 30 days.](media/recoverability/overview-deletes.png)\n+![Diagram that shows that users, Microsoft 365 Groups, cloud security groups, and applications are soft deleted and then hard deleted after 30 days.](media/recoverability/overview-deletes.png)\n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > All other object types are hard deleted immediately when they're selected for deletion. When an object is hard deleted, it can't be recovered. It must be re-created and reconfigured.\n@@ -137,7 +137,7 @@ Use [Conditional Access Graph APIs](/graph/api/resources/conditionalaccesspolicy\n \n ### Map the dependencies among objects\n \n-The deletion of some objects can cause a ripple effect because of dependencies. For example, deletion of a security group used for application assignment would result in users who were members of that group being unable to access the applications to which the group was assigned.\n+The deletion of some objects can cause a ripple effect because of dependencies. For example, deletion of a cloud security group used for application assignment would result in users who were members of that group being unable to access the applications to which the group was assigned.\n \n #### Common dependencies\n \n@@ -146,7 +146,7 @@ The deletion of some objects can cause a ripple effect because of dependencies.\n | Application object| Service principal (enterprise application).

Only Microsoft 365 Groups are soft deleted. If you see a Delete group entry, it might be the soft delete of a Microsoft 365 Group or the hard delete of another type of group. Your documentation of your known good state should include the group type for each group in your organization.\n+> The Audit log doesn't distinguish the group type of a deleted group. Microsoft 365 Groups and cloud security groups are soft deleted. If you see a Delete group entry, it might be the soft delete of a Microsoft 365 Group or cloud security group, or the hard delete of another type of group. Your documentation of your known good state should include the group type for each group in your organization.\n \n For information on monitoring configuration changes, see [Recover from misconfigurations](recover-from-misconfigurations.md).\n " }, { "sha": "946d242fd7fe0b325d7dc8bebfee8cfc788c9187", "filename": "docs/identity/role-based-access-control/protected-actions-overview.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 2, "deletions": 2, "changes": 4, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fidentity%2Frole-based-access-control%2Fprotected-actions-overview.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fidentity%2Frole-based-access-control%2Fprotected-actions-overview.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Frole-based-access-control%2Fprotected-actions-overview.md?ref=572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e", "patch": "@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: role-based-access-control\n ms.custom: no-azure-ad-ps-ref\n ms.topic: article\n-ms.date: 01/31/2025\n+ms.date: 11/03/2025\n ---\n \n # What are protected actions in Microsoft Entra ID?\n@@ -72,7 +72,7 @@ Here's the initial set of permissions:\n \n Microsoft Entra ID supports two types of deletion for most directory objects: soft deletion and hard deletion. When a directory object is soft deleted, the object, its property values and relationships are preserved in the recycle bin for 30 days. A soft-deleted object can be restored with the same ID and all the property values and relationships intact. When a soft-deleted object is hard deleted, the object is permanently deleted and it cannot be recreated with the same object ID.\n \n-To help protect against accidental or malicious hard deletions of some soft-deleted directory objects from the recycle bin and permanent data loss, you can add a protected action for the following permission. This deletion applies to users, Microsoft 365 groups, and applications.\n+To help protect against accidental or malicious hard deletions of some soft-deleted directory objects from the recycle bin and permanent data loss, you can add a protected action for the following permission. This deletion applies to users, Microsoft 365 groups, cloud security groups, and applications.\n \n - microsoft.directory/deletedItems/delete\n " }, { "sha": "e18f2bf6409567f894cd01df353602b7bb1d17df", "filename": "docs/identity/users/groups-restore-deleted.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 12, "deletions": 12, "changes": 24, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fidentity%2Fusers%2Fgroups-restore-deleted.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fidentity%2Fusers%2Fgroups-restore-deleted.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fusers%2Fgroups-restore-deleted.md?ref=572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e", "patch": "@@ -1,32 +1,32 @@\n ---\n-title: Restore a deleted Microsoft 365 group\n+title: Restore a deleted Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group\n description: Learn how to restore a deleted group, view restorable groups, and permanently delete a group in Microsoft Entra ID.\n author: barclayn\n manager: pmwongera\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: users\n ms.topic: quickstart\n-ms.date: 03/27/2025\n+ms.date: 11/03/2025\n ms.author: barclayn\n ms.reviewer: krbain\n ms.custom: it-pro, mode-other, has-azure-ad-ps-ref, azure-ad-ref-level-one-done, sfi-ga-nochange\n ---\n-# Restore a deleted Microsoft 365 group in Microsoft Entra ID\n+# Restore a deleted Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group in Microsoft Entra ID\n \n-When you delete a Microsoft 365 group in Microsoft Entra ID, the deleted group is retained but not visible for 30 days from the deletion date. This behavior is so that the group and its contents can be restored if needed. This functionality is restricted exclusively to Microsoft 365 groups in Microsoft Entra ID. It isn't available for security groups and distribution groups. The 30-day group restoration period isn't customizable.\n+When you delete a Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group in Microsoft Entra ID, the deleted group is retained but not visible for 30 days from the deletion date. This behavior is so that the group and its contents can be restored if needed. This functionality is available for Microsoft 365 groups and cloud security groups in Microsoft Entra ID. It isn't available for distribution groups. The 30-day group restoration period isn't customizable.\n \n Permissions that are required to restore a group are listed in the following table.\n \n Role | Permissions\n --------- | ---------\n-Global Administrator, Group Administrator, Partner Tier 2 Support, and Intune Administrator | Can restore any deleted Microsoft 365 group\n-User Administrator and Partner Tier 1 Support | Can restore any deleted Microsoft 365 group except those groups assigned to the Global Administrator role\n+Global Administrator, Group Administrator, Partner Tier 2 Support, and Intune Administrator | Can restore any deleted Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group\n+User Administrator and Partner Tier 1 Support | Can restore any deleted Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group except those groups assigned to the Global Administrator role\n User | Can restore any deleted Microsoft 365 group that they own\n \n >[!NOTE]\n-> Soft delete is available for both M365 groups with assigned membership and M365 groups with dynamic membership. At this time, soft delete is not available for security groups.\n+> Soft delete is available for Microsoft 365 groups with assigned membership, Microsoft 365 groups with dynamic membership, and cloud security groups.\n \n-## View and manage the deleted Microsoft 365 groups that are available to restore\n+## View and manage the deleted Microsoft 365 groups and cloud security groups that are available to restore\n \n 1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Groups Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#groups-administrator).\n 1. Select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n@@ -39,11 +39,11 @@ User | Can restore any deleted Microsoft 365 group that they own\n - Restore the deleted group and its contents by selecting **Restore group**.\n - Permanently remove the deleted group by selecting **Delete permanently**. To permanently remove a group, you must be an administrator.\n \n-## View the deleted Microsoft 365 groups that are available to restore by using PowerShell\n+## View the deleted Microsoft 365 groups and cloud security groups that are available to restore by using PowerShell\n \n Use the following cmdlets to view the deleted groups. You need to verify that the groups you're interested in weren't permanently purged. These cmdlets are part of the [Microsoft Graph PowerShell module](/powershell/microsoftgraph/installation?view=graph-powershell-1.0&preserve-view=true). For more information about this module, see [Microsoft Graph PowerShell overview](/powershell/microsoftgraph/overview?view=graph-powershell-1.0&preserve-view=true).\n \n-Run the following cmdlet to display all deleted Microsoft 365 groups in your Microsoft Entra organization that are still available to restore. Install the [Graph](/powershell/microsoftgraph/installation?view=graph-powershell-1.0&preserve-view=true) beta version if it isn't already installed on the machine.\n+Run the following cmdlet to display all deleted Microsoft 365 groups and cloud security groups in your Microsoft Entra organization that are still available to restore. Install the [Graph](/powershell/microsoftgraph/installation?view=graph-powershell-1.0&preserve-view=true) beta version if it isn't already installed on the machine.\n \n ```powershell\n Install-Module Microsoft.Graph.Beta\n@@ -57,7 +57,7 @@ Alternatively, if you know the object ID of a specific group (and you can get it\n Get-MgBetaDirectoryDeletedGroup -DirectoryObjectId \n ```\n \n-## Restore your deleted Microsoft 365 group\n+## Restore your deleted Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group\n \n After you verify that the group is still available to restore, restore the deleted group with one of the following steps. If the group contains documents, SharePoint sites, or other persistent objects, it might take up to 24 hours to fully restore a group and its contents.\n \n@@ -75,7 +75,7 @@ Remove-MgBetaDirectoryDeletedItem -DirectoryObjectId \n \n ## How do you know restoration worked?\n \n-To verify that you successfully restored a Microsoft 365 group, run the `Get-MgBetaGroup –GroupId ` cmdlet to display information about the group. After the restore request is completed:\n+To verify that you successfully restored a Microsoft 365 group or cloud security group, run the `Get-MgBetaGroup –GroupId ` cmdlet to display information about the group. After the restore request is completed:\n \n - The group appears in the left navigation pane on Exchange.\n - The plan for the group appears in Planner." }, { "sha": "4c70204fa072b769c8533d0292b61da6b494b512", "filename": "docs/verified-id/whats-new.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 4, "deletions": 0, "changes": 4, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fverified-id%2Fwhats-new.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fverified-id%2Fwhats-new.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fverified-id%2Fwhats-new.md?ref=572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e", "patch": "@@ -18,6 +18,10 @@ ms.author: barclayn\n This article lists the latest features, improvements, and changes in the Microsoft Entra Verified ID service.\n \n \n+## October 2025\n+\n+Partner Gallery Update: Reorganized content and removed deprecated individual partner pages.\n+\n ## September 2025\n \n - Entra Verified ID is supported on Microsoft GCC environments. " } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: The recent updates focus on enhancing the recoverability of Microsoft Entra ID objects, specifically by extending soft-delete capabilities to cloud security groups. This change impacts documentation related to recoverability, protected actions, and group restoration, ensuring that these groups, similar to Microsoft 365 groups, can be restored within a 30-day window. Additionally, a minor update has been made to the Verified ID partner gallery documentation.
